intro: Meibomia plectocarpa, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, round seeds. It is adapted to grow in dry, sandy soils and is often found in savanna habitats. Meibomia plectocarpa is notable for its ability to thrive in arid conditions and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
